message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SE, cs.OS, cs.SY, cs.DC

This paper primarily focuses on security and privacy in mobile devices, specifically on controlling peripherals even when the platform software is compromised. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the design of a secure kernel that co-exists with software running on mobile devices, which falls under the category of cs.SE (Software Engineering). Additionally, the paper mentions the use of ARM TrustZone technology, which is related to cs.OS (Operating Systems) and cs.SY (Systems and Control). Finally, the paper discusses the performance overhead of the proposed solution, which is related to cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing).
